Package com.topdesk.cases.toprob.helper

Class GridFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.topdesk.cases.toprob.helper.GridFactory
  • public final class GridFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class to create a Grid. Use this class by calling its static method create(java.lang.String...).

    A grid is created by parsing an array of strings. The first character of the first element of this array corresponds with Coordinate [0, 0]. The last character of the last element of this array corresponds with Coordinate [width - 1, height - 1]. Where width and height are the dimensions of the grid.

    The characters of these strings can be (and can only be):

    • '.' - empty cell
    • 'r' - Rob's room
    • 'k' - the kitchen
    • 'o' - a hole; there can be multiple holes
    • Any character greater than or equal to 'A' and smaller than or equal to 'Z' - These are the different positions of the bug. 'A' is the position of the bug at time 0, 'B' is the position of the bug at time 1, etc. After all bug cells have been used, the sequence starts over again.

    Requirements:

    • The grid is rectangular. That is why all elements in the given string array have to be of equal length.
    • The room, the kitchen and the bug are all mandatory.
    • There can be zero or more holes.
    • The bug has to appear at at least two places. That is why there should be at least an 'A' and a 'B' in the strings to parse.
    • The upper case characters for the bug must be consecutive, e.g. there cannot be a 'D' without also an 'A', a 'B' and a 'C'.

    Example:

    .r.k.
    ...oo
    A.C.B

    • This grid has width 5 and height 3
    • The room is at coordinate [1, 0]
    • The kitchen is at coordinate [3, 0]
    • There are holes at coordinates [3, 1] and [4, 1]
    • The bug moves between coordinates [0, 2] (at time=0), [4, 2] (at time=1), [2, 2] (at time=2), [0, 2] (at time=3), [4, 2] (at time=4), etc.

        public static Grid create​(java.lang.String... lines)
        Creates a grid by parsing the given lines. See the documentation on the level of this class for more detailed documentation.
        Parameters:
        lines - an array of strings to be parsed
        Returns:
        the Grid
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if lines is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the requirements as described on the level of this class is violated
